Package com.clorem.db

Class Node

java.lang.Object
com.clorem.db.Node
public class Node extends Object
This class represent a node in the database. A node is like a folder which may contain other folders or files. You can perform all the CRUD operations on a node using this class. See documentation for more info.

    • name

      public String name

  • Constructor Details

    • Node

      public Node(org.json.JSONObject object, org.json.JSONObject root, String name)

  • Method Details

    • node

      public Node node(@NonNull String name)
      Enters into the node present in the current node if exist, creates otherwise.
      Parameters:
      name - The name or relative path of the node.
      Returns:
      The new node.

    • delete

      public void delete()
      Deletes the current node including its children. You don't need to call commit() after calling this. Any operation performed on the node after calling this method will result in NullPointerException as this node becomes null when deleted.

    • put

      public Node put(@NonNull String key, @NonNull Object pojo)

    • put

      public Node put(@NonNull String key, @Nullable String value)
      Creates a new key-value pair in the current node. Updates if already exist.
      Parameters:
      key - The key to access the value
      value - The string value to put. null to remove existing mapping.
      Returns:
      The current node

    • put

      public Node put(@NonNull String key, long value)
      Creates a new key-value pair in the current node. Updates if already exist.
      Parameters:
      key - The key to access the value
      value - The long or int value to put.
      Returns:
      The current node

    • put

      public Node put(@NonNull String key, boolean value)
      Creates a new key-value pair in the current node. Updates if already exist.
      Parameters:
      key - The key to access the value
      value - The boolean value to put.
      Returns:
      The current node

    • put

      public Node put(@NonNull String key, double value)
      Creates a new key-value pair in the current node. Updates if already exist.
      Parameters:
      key - The key to access the value
      value - The double value to put.
      Returns:
      The current node

    • putStringList

      public Node putStringList(@NonNull String key, @Nullable List<String> list)
      Creates a new list current node. Updates if already exist.
      Parameters:
      key - The key to access the list. null to remove existing one.
      list - The list to put.
      Returns:
      The current node

    • putIntList

      public Node putIntList(@NonNull String key, @Nullable List<Integer> list)
      Creates a new list current node. Updates if already exist.
      Parameters:
      key - The key to access the list. null to remove existing one.
      list - The list to put.
      Returns:
      The current node

    • getString

      public String getString(@NonNull String key, String defaultValue)
      Gets the string from the current node in the database.
      Parameters:
      key - The key of the value
      Returns:
      The value that the key holds, or defaultValue if key not exist.

    • getNumber

      public long getNumber(@NonNull String key, long defaultValue)
      Gets the number from the database. This number could either be an int or a long depending on what did you put.
      Parameters:
      key - The key of the value
      Returns:
      The value that the key holds, or defaultValue if key not exist.

    • getBoolean

      public boolean getBoolean(@NonNull String key, boolean defaultValue)
      Gets the boolean from the current node in the database.
      Parameters:
      key - The key of the value
      Returns:
      The value that the key holds, or defaultValue if key not exist.

    • getDecimal

      public double getDecimal(@NonNull String key, double defaultValue)
      Gets the floating point number from the current node in the database. This number can either be a float or a double depending on what did you put.
      Parameters:
      key - The key of the value.
      Returns:
      The value that the key holds, or defaultValue if key not exist.

    • getObject

      public <T> T getObject(@NonNull String key, Class<T> clazz)
      Gets the POJO associated with the key.
      Parameters:
      key - The key of the POJO.
      clazz - type of the object that the key contain.
      Returns:
      The Object of class type 'clazz'

    • getListString

      @NonNull public List<String> getListString(@NonNull String key)
      Gets the List of type String from the current node in the database.
      Parameters:
      key - The key of the list.
      Returns:
      The list that the key holds, otherwise an empty list but never null.

    • getListInt

      @NonNull public List<Integer> getListInt(String key)
      Gets the List of type Integer from the current node in the database.
      Parameters:
      key - The key of the list.
      Returns:
      The list that the key holds, otherwise an empty list but never null.

    • getChildren

      public ArrayList<String> getChildren()
      Get the keys of all the children present in this node
      Returns:
      The list of the keys.

    • query

      public Query query()
      Use this to run queries on your database. All queries should be run from the parent node which contains many same types of sub-nodes of the child you want to query. For example if you have a node 'users' with many sub-nodes as "userA","userB',"userC" then you have to query from "users" node.
      Returns:
      Query object to run queries.

    • commit

      public void commit()
      Commit the changes to the database. This method will erase everything from the memory after writing it to database. This should be the last call of database as this will call garbage collector to free up memory which will destroy the current instance of database. This method's runs synchronously.
